noun.description: A person who uses or is given to anthropomorphism, especially (in early use) with regard to God or (now more usually) animals.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in William Gouge (1575–1653), Church of England clergyman and author. From post-classical Latin anthropomorphistae (plural) anthropomorphites, variant or alteration (after nouns in -ista) of anthropomorphitae.
